description: Bring the power of the world's largest professional network to your apps

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Exchange Authorization Code for an Access Token.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Required: The `Secret Key` value generated in prevoius OAuth step. Follow the Best Practices guide (https://developer.linkedin.com/docs/best-practices#keysecret) for handing your clientSecret value.

blocks.name: getProfileData
blocks.description: Once you have obtained a valid access token for the user, you can use the following REST API call to retrieve basic profile data for the user.

args.name: fields
args.info: There are additional company profile fields available that are not returned as part of the default call.

args.name: profileLanguage
args.info: LinkedIn members have the opportunity to provide their profile information in multiple languages. To specify the language you would prefer to have returned, you include an `profileLanguage` to request. The value of the `profileLanguage` should be a comma separated list of Language Codes (https://developer.linkedin.com/docs/reference/language-codes), ordered from highest to lowest priority of preference. Example: `es-ES, en-US`

blocks.name: createSharedContent
blocks.description:
Use Share on LinkedIn to: Grow your user base and drive traffic to your website, 
Get your content in front of a potential audience of millions of professionals, 
Benefit from viral distribution as people share your content with their professional networks

args.name: comment
args.info: Required: A comment by the member to associated with the share. If none of the above content parameters are provided, the comment must contain a URL to the content you want to share.  If the comment contains multiple URLs, only the first one will be analyzed for content to share.

args.name: visibilityCode
args.info: Required: One of the following values: `anyone`:  Share will be visible to all members. `connections-only`:  Share will only be visible to connections of the member performing the share.

args.name: contentTitle
args.info: Required: The title of the content being shared.

args.name: contentDescription
args.info: Optional if you post with url: The description of the content being shared.

args.name: contentSubmittedUrl
args.info: Optional if you post with url: The description of the content being shared.

args.name: contentSubmittedImageUrl
args.info: Optional if you post with url: A fully qualified URL to a thumbnail image to accompany the shared content. The image should be at least 80 x 150px for best results.

blocks.name: checkCompanySharing
blocks.description: This call returns a simple boolean value that indicates whether the company specified by the `companyId` value in the request has sharing enabled or disabled.  Sharing is enabled (i.e. true) by default.

blocks.name: checkMemberIsCompanyAdministrator
blocks.description: The API calls listed on this page require the member to be an administrator of the target company.  This call returns a simple boolean value that indicates whether the currently authenticated user is configured to be an administrator of the company specified by the `companyId` value in the request.

blocks.name: getCompaniesWhereUserAdministrator
blocks.description: The API calls listed on this page require the member to be an administrator of the target company. This call returns a list of all of the companies that the authenticated user is currently configured to be an administrator of.  If the user is an administrator of more than 10 companies, you will need to use the optional start and count parameters to page through the complete result set.  The total number of companies that the member is an administrator of is returned in the body of the request.  You can use this value to determine whether you need to make additional paged requests to retrieve the complete list of companies for the user.

args.name: start
args.info: The offset value for paginating update results by.

args.name: count
args.info: Maximum number of updates to return.

blocks.name: getCompanyProfile
blocks.description: This call will return profile information about the company specified by the `companyId` value in the request.

args.name: fields
args.info: There are additional company profile fields available that are not returned as part of the default call.  The following example illustrates how you modify your request to ask for additional profile fields beyond the default values.

blocks.name: getCompanyUpdates
blocks.description: This call returns a list of update events from the from the LinkedIn company page of the company identified by the `companyId` value in the request.

args.name: start
args.info: The offset value for paginating update results by.

args.name: count
args.info: Maximum number of updates to return.

blocks.name: getSingleCompanyUpdate
blocks.description: This call will return a single specific company update record for the company identified by the `companyId` value and the update identified by the `updateKey` value in the request.

blocks.name: getSingleCompanyUpdateComments
blocks.description: This call will return all of the comments for the company update identified by `updateKey` for the company identified by the `companyId` value in the request.  A maximum of 100 comments will be returned.

blocks.name: getSingleCompanyUpdateLikes
blocks.description: This call will return all of the likes for the company update identified by `updateKey` for the company identified by the `companyId` value in the request.  By default, the most recent 100 likes will be returned.

args.name: comment
args.info: A comment by the member to associated with the share. If none of the above content parameters are provided, the comment must contain a URL to the content you want to share.  If the comment contains multiple URLs, only the first one will be analyzed for content to share.

args.name: visibilityCode
args.info:
One of the following values: `anyone`:  Share will be visible to all members. 
 `connections-only`:  Share will only be visible to connections of the member performing the share. 
This field is required in all sharing calls.

args.name: contentTitle
args.info: The title of the content being shared.

args.name: contentDescription
args.info: The description of the content being shared.

args.name: contentSubmittedUrl
args.info: A fully qualified URL for the content being shared.

args.name: contentSubmittedImageUrl
args.info: A fully qualified URL to a thumbnail image to accompany the shared content. The image should be at least 80 x 150px for best results. 2MB max filesize.

args.name: shareTargets
args.info: A collection of targeting codes and values used to ensure that the shared content reaches a specific audience.

blocks.name: getCompanyFollowers
blocks.description: If you choose to target content that you share on behalf of a company, there is a minumum number of followers that must make up the segment you are targeting before you will be able to successfully share the targeted content.  This request allows you to get a follower-count for a specific segment to ensure you are at or over the minimum requirement for the target segment for the company specified by the `companyId` value in the request.

args.name: geo
args.info: Segment by a particular geographic area.

args.name: companySizes
args.info: Segment by a particular company size targeting code.

args.name: jobFunc
args.info: Segment by member job function targeting code.

args.name: seniorities
args.info: Segment by member seniority level targeting code.

blocks.name: addCommentOnCompanyBehalf
blocks.description: This call will allow you to submit a comment on a company update on behalf of a company, rather than a member.  The comment is submitted for the update identified by `updateKey` under the company identified by `companyId` in the request.

args.name: comment
args.info: Required: A comment by the company to associated with the share. If none of the above content parameters are provided, the comment must contain a URL to the content you want to share.  If the comment contains multiple URLs, only the first one will be analyzed for content to share.

blocks.name: getCompanyHistoricalFollowerStatistics
blocks.description: This call retrieves statistics about followers for a particular company page identified by the `companyId` value in the request.  The request returns a follower count for both paid and organic followers within all of the days or months in the selected date range, based on the requested granularity.

args.name: timeGranularity
args.info: Required: Granularity of statistics. Supported values are: `day`, `month`

args.name: startTimestamp
args.info: Required: Starting timestamp of when the stats search should begin (milliseconds since epoch).

args.name: endTimestamp
args.info: Ending timestamp of when the stats search should end (milliseconds since epoch). The current time will be used if parameter not set.

blocks.name: getCompanyHistoricalStatusUpdateStatistics
blocks.description: The Historical Status Update Statistics API provides impression and engagement data on company shares for a given company page.

args.name: timeGranularity
args.info: Required: Granularity of statistics. Supported values are: `day`, `month`

args.name: startTimestamp
args.info: Required: Starting timestamp of when the stats search should begin (milliseconds since epoch).

args.name: endTimestamp
args.info: Ending timestamp of when the stats search should end (milliseconds since epoch). The current time will be used if parameter not set.

args.name: updateKey
args.info: Optionally provide an update key value to return statistics for a specific company update.

blocks.name: getCompanyPageStatistics
blocks.description: The Historical Status Update Statistics API provides impression and engagement data on company shares for a given company page. The API provides much better flexibility and granularity levels on company share stats compared to the existing Company Statistics API. The API can support statistics at both the aggregate and individual status update level. In addition, statistics retrieved by this API are up-to-date in real time.
